speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: SCENE II. Another street.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO, IAGO, and Attendants with torches

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Though in the trade of war I have slain men,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Yet do I hold it very stuff o' the conscience

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To do no contrived murder: I lack iniquity

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Sometimes to do me service: nine or ten times

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I had thought to have yerk'd him here under the ribs.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis better as it is.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nay, but he prated,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And spoke such scurvy and provoking terms

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Against your honour

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That, with the little godliness I have,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I did full hard forbear him. But, I pray you, sir,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Are you fast married? Be assured of this,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That the magnifico is much beloved,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And hath in his effect a voice potential

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As double as the duke's: he will divorce you;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Or put upon you what restraint and grievance

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The law, with all his might to enforce it on,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will give him cable.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let him do his spite:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My services which I have done the signiory

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Shall out-tongue his complaints. 'Tis yet to know,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Which, when I know that boasting is an honour,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I shall promulgate--I fetch my life and being

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: From men of royal siege, and my demerits

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: May speak unbonneted to as proud a fortune

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As this that I have reach'd: for know, Iago,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But that I love the gentle Desdemona,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I would not my unhoused free condition

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Put into circumscription and confine

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For the sea's worth. But, look! what lights come yond?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Those are the raised father and his friends:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You were best go in.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Not I I must be found:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My parts, my title and my perfect soul

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Shall manifest me rightly. Is it they?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: By Janus, I think no.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter CASSIO, and certain Officers with torches

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The servants of the duke, and my lieutenant.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The goodness of the night upon you, friends!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What is the news?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: The duke does greet you, general,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And he requires your haste-post-haste appearance,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Even on the instant.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What is the matter, think you?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Something from Cyprus as I may divine:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: It is a business of some heat: the galleys

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Have sent a dozen sequent messengers

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: This very night at one another's heels,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And many of the consuls, raised and met,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Are at the duke's already: you have been

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: hotly call'd for;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: When, being not at your lodging to be found,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: The senate hath sent about three several guests

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: To search you out.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis well I am found by you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I will but spend a word here in the house,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And go with you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Ancient, what makes he here?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Faith, he to-night hath boarded a land carack:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If it prove lawful prize, he's made for ever.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I do not understand.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He's married.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: To who?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Re-enter OTHELLO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Marry, to--Come, captain, will you go?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Have with you.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Here comes another troop to seek for you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It is Brabantio. General, be advised;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He comes to bad intent.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter BRABANTIO, RODERIGO, and Officers with torches and weapons

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Holla! stand there!

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Signior, it is the Moor.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Down with him, thief!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: They draw on both sides

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You, Roderigo! come, sir, I am for you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Keep up your bright swords, for the dew will rust them.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Good signior, you shall more command with years

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Than with your weapons.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: O thou foul thief, where hast thou stow'd my daughter?

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Damn'd as thou art, thou hast enchanted her;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: For I'll refer me to all things of sense,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: If she in chains of magic were not bound,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Whether a maid so tender, fair and happy,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: So opposite to marriage that she shunned

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: The wealthy curled darlings of our nation,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Would ever have, to incur a general mock,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Run from her guardage to the sooty bosom

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Of such a thing as thou, to fear, not to delight.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Judge me the world, if 'tis not gross in sense

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: That thou hast practised on her with foul charms,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Abused her delicate youth with drugs or minerals

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: That weaken motion: I'll have't disputed on;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: 'Tis probable and palpable to thinking.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I therefore apprehend and do attach thee

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: For an abuser of the world, a practiser

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Of arts inhibited and out of warrant.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Lay hold upon him: if he do resist,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Subdue him at his peril.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Hold your hands,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Both you of my inclining, and the rest:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Were it my cue to fight, I should have known it

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Without a prompter. Where will you that I go

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To answer this your charge?

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: To prison, till fit time

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Of law and course of direct session

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Call thee to answer.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What if I do obey?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How may the duke be therewith satisfied,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Whose messengers are here about my side,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Upon some present business of the state

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To bring me to him?

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: 'Tis true, most worthy signior;

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: The duke's in council and your noble self,

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: I am sure, is sent for.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: How! the duke in council!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: In this time of the night! Bring him away:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Mine's not an idle cause: the duke himself,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Or any of my brothers of the state,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Cannot but feel this wrong as 'twere their own;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: For if such actions may have passage free,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Bond-slaves and pagans shall our statesmen be.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Exeunt
